alfredsnippet.snippet:
Quasars, Redshifts & Controversies, Halton Arp, p.169

"One danger ... is that with science tied increasingly closely to expensive equipment, which in turn is tied to prominent institutions, that science may progress much less rapidly than its potential ... In fact, it might even become so that, as in the arts, the truly most creative and important achievements in science will not take place within the universities or institutions at all."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Arp on Universities - Part 1
